TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed WebPartsPersonalization extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement

Docs.summary: Allows you to specify the personalization provider and set personalization authorizations. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks WebPartsPersonalization provides configuration support for personalization options for Web Parts, such as the personalization provider and personalization authorizations.
## Examples This example demonstrates how to specify values declaratively for several attributes of the `webParts` section, which can also be accessed as members of the WebPartsPersonalization class.
The following configuration file example shows how to specify values declaratively for the `webParts` section.
``` <system.web> <webParts> <personalization defaultProvider="AspNetSqlPersonalizationProvider"> <!â€”- Providers may only be defined at the application level --> <providers> <add name="AspNetSqlPersonalizationProvider" type="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.SqlPersonalizationProvider" connectionStringName="LocalSqlServer" applicationName="/" /> </providers> <authorization> <deny users="*" verbs="enterSharedScope" /> <allow users="*" verbs="modifyState" /> </authorization> </personalization> </webParts> </system.web> ```
The following code example demonstrates how to use the WebPartsPersonalization class.
This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.configurati_85_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.configurati_85_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using default settings.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code. It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system. An instance of this class is available from the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection.Personalization%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets an object containing the Web Parts personalization authorizations for the current Web application.
Docs.value: An object containing the Web Parts personalization authorizations for the current Web application.

remarks.format:
## Remarks There must be at least one valid verb associated with each <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule> object in the collection.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the Authorization property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection#15](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.configurati_18_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection#15](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.configurati_18_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the default Web Parts personalization provider.
Docs.value: The name of the default Web Parts personalization provider.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsPersonalization.Providers%2A> property contains the Web Parts personalization providers for the current Web application.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the DefaultProvider property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection#13](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.configurati_333_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection#13](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.configurati_333_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a collection that contains the Web Parts personalization providers for the current Web application.
Docs.value: A collection that contains the Web Parts personalization providers for the current Web application.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Web Parts personalization providers can only be defined at the Web-application level (in a Web.config file).
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the Providers property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection#14](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.configurati_148_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection#14](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.configurati_148_1.vb)]
